title: Pehlu Khan (55) and others
victim_names: Pehlu Khan (55), Azmat (22), Irshad, Aarif and Rafiq
victiom_action: were legally transporting two milch cows in a pickup truck on a Haryana-bound highway in Rajasthan
accused_action: saw the victims's pick-up on the highway and assumed that they were illegally transporting bovines.
the_lynching: The Gau Rakshaks intercepted the pick-up and proceeded to beat up the men. Pehlu Khan succumbs to injuries.

title: Mohammad Majloom (35) and others
victim_crime: Primarily theft. But also against cow slaughter.
victiom_action: were legally walking with the cattle at night
accused_names: Mithilesh Prasad Sahu, Pramod Kumar Sahu, Manoj Kumar Sahu, Manoj Sahu
accused_action: wanted to steal the victim's cows.
the_lynching: The villagers beat up the victims with sticks, strangled them and hanged their bodies on trees and finally hid their cows in the forest.

title: Mohammad Akhlaq (52) and others
accused_action: heard a rumour that a cow had been slaughtered and beef was stored in Akhlaq's house.
the_lynching: A mob of 200 stormed the house and beat up Akhlaq and son (22). Akhlaq died.

title: Anaf and and others
accused_action: discovered the theft at 4am and started following the theives. At 6am they intercepted the theives.
the_lynching: The suspected thieves opened fire. While two of the five suspected thieves fled, three were allegedly beaten to death by the angry mob.

title: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and others
victim_names: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and Showkat Ahmed (35)
victiom_action: were driving a truck loaded with coal to Srinagar
accused_action: had stopped traffic in view of the strike following recovery of three carcasses in the district.
the_lynching: A mob of 9 people threw a petrol bomb on Zahid's coal-laden truck. Zahid suffered 60% burn injuries and later succembed.

title: Noman (20) and others
victiom_action: were rashly driving a truck with cattle
accused_action: suspected that the cattle was being taken to Uttar Pradesh for slaughter.
the_lynching: The truck failed to negotiate a sharp turn and crashed. The villagers secured the cattle, caught the people travelling in the truck and beat them up. The villagers handed four of them to the police. Police found a critically-injured Noman by the mountainside the next day. He was taken to a local hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries.

title: Nazakat Ali (45) and others
victim_names: Nazakat Ali (45), Naseema (40), Sabar Ali (60), Abida Bibi (22) and Saina (8)
victiom_action: were legally moving with their cattle herd on foot from the plains to highland pastures
accused_tag: allegedly from Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal
the_lynching: gathered and started beating them.

title: Mohammed Hussain (43) and others
victiom_action: traveling in the general compartment of the Kushinagar Express
accused_action: claimed they acted on a tip-off about beef being transported by some passengers so they started searching the luggage of all passengers in the compartment
the_lynching: This led to a scuffle. A black bag was found with suspected beef, which later turned out to be buffalo meat after laboratory tests. The owners of that bag were not found.

title: Unknown
victiom_action: were illegally carrying 30 kgs meat at Mandsaur railway station
accused_action: suspected that they were carrying beef
the_lynching: The gau rakshaks beat up the women. The meat later turned out to be buffalo meat. Importing of buffalo meat inside Madhya Pradesh without permission is illegal and thus both the women have been taken into custody for ‘smuggling and trying to sell’ the meat.

title: Mota Samadhiyala (46) and others
victim_names: Balu Sarvaiya (46), Vashram (26), Kunvarben, Ramesh (23), Bechar Sarvaiya (30), Ashok Sarvaiya (20) and Deveshi Babariya (32).
accused_names: Pramodigiri Goswami, Balvant Balvant Dhiru, Rasik, Ramesh Jadav, Rakesh Joshi and Nagji Ahir
accused_action: suspected that they had slaughtered the cow
the_lynching: Gau rakshaks started abusing the victims and attacked them with iron pipes, sticks and a knife with which the victims were removing the skin of the carcass. After beating them up, the attackers reportedly took Vashram, Ramesh, Ashok and Bechar to Una town. There, they paraded the four victims, and flogged them publicly all the way to the police station.

title: Rizwan and others
accused_action: claimed they acted on a tip-off. They chased the victim's car for 7 kms before they finally managed to stop them.
the_lynching: They forced the victims to eat a concoction of cow dung, cow urine, milk, curd and ghee. The gau rakshaks later turned over the two men to Faridabad police.

title: Unknown
victim_names: Kalu Baghel, Sonbeer, Vinod, Bunty, Chhotey and Imran
accused_action: spotted the blood at the dairy.
the_lynching: Locals broke into the diary and attacked the owner and others.

title: Mustain Abbas (27)
victiom_action: legally transporting two buffalos that he had bought
accused_action: had blocked the road with tractors
the_lynching: The victims tried to turn their pick-up around but thorns on the road punctured their tyre. The gau rakshaks started firing. The 5 victims jumped out of the car and ran. The gau rakshaks caught Mustain, beat, stabbed and strangled him to death. Mustain's body was found a month later in a drain.

title: Dhanush (23) and others
which_law: One can legally slaughter a cow only with a fitness certificate — if they are old or diseased.
the_lynching: The gau rakshaks raiding their house and attacking the men before notifying the police.

title: Mokati Elisha and others
accused_action: suspected that they had slaughtered the cow
the_lynching: The cow died of electrocution.

title: Apuda Malviya
accused_names: Chetan Sankhla, Vikas alias Bhura, Nilesh Sankhla and Shubham
accused_action: suspected that the victim injured a cow
the_lynching: A mob of around five-six men beating the victim using belts and slippers.

title: Abu Hanifa (23) and others
victiom_action: stole two cows from the grazing field
the_lynching: The police on Monday did not term the incident as a case of ‘cow vigilantism’.

title: Narendra Kushwah (35) and others
victiom_action: raped a girl and then tried to threaten the girl's family to withdraw the complaint against him

title: Rajiv Sahni (25)
victiom_action: trying to escape following a failed attempt of vehicle theft
the_lynching: Rajiv was caught by some villagers when he and his accomplice Rajaram Kevat tried to flee from the spot after failed theft bid. While four suspected thieves managed to run away in the car they had come, Sahni and Kevat were overpowered by the villagers.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Police found an unidentified man with eyes punctured and tongue slashed.

title: Sandeep Kumar, BSF Officer
the_lynching: The clash took place when the BSF personnel were chasing smugglers during a routine patrol in the area near the Indo-Bangla border. The villagers attacked the security men with lathis and lynched one of them. The other opened fire in self-defence and killed one villager Ismail Mia and injured nine other.

title: Shazir (45)
the_lynching: Hours after he was booked on charges of cow slaughter, a Muslim trader was beaten to death allegedly by a Hindu m.

title: Pintu Biswas (42)
the_lynching: Mob lynched man after he protested against busting of illegal crackers in front of a Kali Puja pandal.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: A lawyer was allegedly shot dead on Monday morning by four unidentified persons who were later lynched by a mob at Kheri Gani village here, police said.

title: Mohsin Sadiq Shaikh (24)
the_lynching: Derogatory pictures of Shivaji and Bal Thackeray uploaded on Facebook triggered communal tension across the city. Victim was returning home with friend. Mob of Hindu extremists identified him as a muslim because of his beard and skull cap and beat him to death.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Villagers suspected 2 youths were involved in mobile theft cases. They were called by villagers under a false pretext of enquiring about a theft and were taken to isolated spot and beaten up, tied up and then paraded naked by a mob of more than 30 people.

title: S K Maheshwari
the_lynching: The CEO of a jute mill was beaten to death and at least two members of the management were left injured by workers agitated over a suggestion that the number of working days in a week be cut from five to three because of losses.

title: Sohan Pal
the_lynching: A 24-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was beaten to death by the passenger over an argument on the fare amount.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: A gang of seven robbers escaped with Rs 6.2 lakh cash and a Bolero vehicle. The villagers gathered and blocked the road by placing tractors and other vehicles. The robbers left the Bolero vehicle after they spotted the villagers and took shelter in cane fields. The villagers, however, surrounded the fields and overpowered two of them while others managed to escape.

title: Chhotu and others
the_lynching: Both boys were talking to each other near a parked tractor. Some villagers mistook them for thieves suspecting them of coming with an intention to steal the tractor’s battery. A tractor battery was stolen from the village last month. They were caught by villagers and beaten mercilessly.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: A provisions store owner was shot dead by four assailants. Villagers caught one of the assailants and lynched him to death.

title: Ali Ansari (28)
the_lynching: Auto-rickshaw driver beaten to death by two inebriated security guards after the rickshaw driver refused to ferry them to their destination.

title: Gulzar Singh Chaudhary (60)
the_lynching: Reportedly, the victim was suspected of stealing a buffalo, and instead of lodging an FIR against him, the police took him to a farmhouse where he was beaten to death.

title: Suspected NDBF terrorist
the_lynching: Curfew was also imposed in Chirang district after police resorted to lathicharge and lobbed teargas shells to disperse a mob which lynched a suspected NDBF terrorist and attacked a police outpost, besides burning down a house here.
lynching of a migrant labourer from Assam Dhubri district by a mob after he was allegedly caught harassing a mentally unstable girl with four of his friends in Tura town in the West Garo Hills.

title: Korban Shah
the_lynching: On November 16, Korban from Uluberia in Howrah, was lynched at NRS medical college hostel.The 30-year-old who was the father of four children, was suspected to have been a thief. His body was found tied around a pillar on the third floor of the hostel. Even after 16 days, the police have not been able to make any arrests.

title: Jeetu
the_lynching: Jeetu, a shoe factory worker, allegedly exposed himself "indecently" when a girl from his neighbourhood was passing by. An irate mob beat him to death later. Both Jeetu’s and the girl’s families belong to Dalit community.

title: Syed Sharif Khan (35)
the_lynching: 35 year old Sharif was accused of raping a college student. Hundreds of girls in school, college uniforms led lynch mob. a mob broke into the Dimapur Central Jail, dragged out a rape accused, tied him by the waist and dragged for seven kilometres — being kicked and pelted with stones along the way until he died.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Four unidentified men from Chhattisgarh who had allegedly come to Koraput to buy ganja (150 kilos) were mistaken for kidnappers of children and beaten to death by villagers.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Three scrap dealers (Rehmat Ali Khan, Habib Sheikh and Rajkumar Yadav) caught the accused while entering the godown around 4 am. There had been recently a theft in the area in which cellphones had been stolen. The accused tied him up and assaulted him, following which the man died.

title: Ikram Khan
the_lynching: Accused allegedly misbehaved with Khan’s mother a few days ago. When Khan confronted a few of them, they attacked him.

title: Deepak Kumar Yadav (23)
the_lynching: A 23-year-old man was beaten to death because he reportedly refused to give Rs 10 to four people for buying gutkha.

title: Maoists
the_lynching: Three Maoists were lynched by tribals while the Maoists were holding a ‘praja court’.

title: Shankar Kadam (40)
the_lynching: Shankar Kadam (40), the president of RPI (Ektawadi), Kalwa region, died after being attacked by an armed mob of 30 people outside his residence. The mob went to the leader’s home allegedly demanding better work to be done in the area.

title: Dhirendra Kumar (36)
the_lynching: In an apparent case of road rage, a 36-year-old driver of a cluster bus was beaten up allegedly by five youths in Southeast Delhi’s Badarpur area on Sunday evening after the bus accidentally grazed their Honda City.

title: Delhi bus driver (42)
the_lynching:
In May this year, a 42-year-old Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus driver was beaten to death after the bus hit a passing motorcycle in West Delhi’s Mundka area.
The motorcycle had apparently moved into the bus lane when it was hit. The motorcyclist and his mother, who was riding pillion, fell, police said. The motorcyclist then assaulted the driver with his helmet.

title: Harshavardhan Rao (19)
the_lynching: A 19-year-old student was beaten to death allegedly by his senior when the former objected to eve-teasing of a girl student at a private college here

title: Constable Ajay Gawand (43)
the_lynching:
Gawand was among a team of policemen to respond to a call of theft at the Bharat Petroleum building in Wadi Bunder on November 16. Histotry-sheeter Santosh Salvi had climbed to the roof of the building and was pelting stones at the policemen below.
Gawand then rushed ahead of his colleagues and onto the roof to confront Salvi alone. However, Salvi allegedly attacked him with a large wooden plank and continued to batter him on the head even after he fell to the ground.By then, other policemen had also reached the roof and overpowered Salvi, but Gawand was declared dead on arrival in J J  Hospital. Gawand had earned a reputation as a daredevil policeman, often confronting criminals without the assistance of his colleagues.

title: Debajani Bora
the_lynching:
It was only on October 15 that Debajani Bora, a well-known veteran athlete and winner of several national and international level medals, was tortured by a group of men and women inside a naam-ghar (community prayer hall) at Dokmoka in Karbi Anglong after a local priest “identified” her as a witch who had allegedly spread diseases and misfortune among the local people.
While a group of men tied Bora with a fishing net, video clippings taken by some persons on the mobile phone showed the priest, one Biswa Medhi, sitting on the woman and beating her up. At least ten persons including eight women, have been already arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Mala Bhumij and others
the_lynching: were beaten up and physically tortured by several men and women until police reached the spot and rescued them. main culprit, a local “bez” (faith-healer) called Santosh. “A local bez on failing to cure a sick 14-year old boy put the blame on witchcraft and pointed at three women living close by following which the neighbours turned violent and severely beat up the three women.

title: Sk Dilwar (25)
the_lynching: Burdwan: A youth was beaten to death Friday when he allegedly went to extort money at Dubrajpur near Burdwan town, the police said. Sources said locals lynched Sk Dilwar (25) when tried to extort money from them at Dubrajpur.

title: Sub-Divisional Police Officer (SDPO) and others
the_lynching: A Sub-Divisional Police Officer (SDPO) and some policemen suffered injuries in stone-throwing by a mob that had gathered on hearing rumours that cows were being taken for slaughter in three vehicles. Police reached the spot and found that it was part of a tradition, where a dead calf’s skin, stuffed with hay, is kept before the cow so that it doesn’t feel the loss of its calf and keeps giving milk,

title: Nasirul Haque (30) and others
the_lynching: Chased by a mob through the village,3 men kept pleading and screaming for mercy, witnesses said, but the mob, blaming the trio for cattle theft, went after them iron rods, wooden sticks and stones. The three victims had past complaints of cattle theft against them, and raids are on to identify others involved in the mob lynching.

title: Riaz (42)
the_lynching: Beating up a Muslim man for allegedly stealing a calf from a cowshed

title: Gulla Soma Banjaran (35) and others
the_lynching: The man killed his two friends because they were involved in transporting cows for slaughter and refused to mend their ways despite being warned.

title: Harish and others
the_lynching: The Karnataka police have booked 13 gau rakshaks for allegedly thrashing three Koraga tribal community youths after accusing them of slaughtering a cow

title: Kallarackal Jose and others
the_lynching: The cow was bought from a Hindu person after the animal was declared infertile by a veterinary surgeon. Jose and another person wanted to slaughter it for Easter. They wanted to distribute the meat among relatives and friends. Cow slaughter is not illegal in Kerala

title: Policemen
the_lynching: Rumours of cow slaughter triggered violence with protesters targeting police vehicles and setting afire shops, leaving seven policemen injured. The post-mortem report found that the cow had died due to an ailment

title: Praveen Poojary (28) and others
the_lynching: The victim was getting ready to transport four calves in a minivan to neighbouring Shimoga district as part of a contract with a cattle dealer. Nearly 30 people, led by local HJV leader Arvind Sherigar, surrounded the minivan and attacked Poojary and Devadiga with iron rods.

title: Manish Mandal (30)
the_lynching: Suffered serious injury on his left eye after he was beaten up for scaring a group of cattle by honking in a bid to move them off the middle of the road

title: Abhishek Gaur and others
the_lynching: Two volunteers of a Gau Raksha Dal were injured Saturday morning after they were shot at, allegedly by persons illegally transporting beef,

title: Abdul Rashid
the_lynching: Minor injuries in an attack on his vehicle by some Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) activists

title: Unknown
the_lynching: A case of rioting was registered after trucks carrying cattle, allegedly for slaughter, were intercepted by residents of Chilla village.

title: Sajid
the_lynching: Several people, including policemen, were injured in a clash after local residents stopped a truck suspecting it was carrying beef. The police had to resort to firing in the air to control the agitated crowd.Police said some local residents spotted three trucks carrying meat were crossing the Palwal-Aligarh road. While two of the trucks managed to pass the area, the third was stopped.

title: Mohammad Majloom (35) and others
the_lynching: The bodies victim were found hanging from a tree. The arrested men claimed they killed victims after they resisted their attempts to steal cattle being taken to a fair for sale.

title: Mohammad Ayub
the_lynching: After the accident the accused got out of their cars and thrashed Ayub with “baseball stick and iron pipe, and injured him that led to his death

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Around 50 cow vigilantes on Sunday attacked a truck from Tamil Nadu ferrying cows on suspicions of cattle smuggling. The accused tried to beat the officials. They also tried to set the truck on fire but police reached the spot and prevented them. Actions were also taken against seven policemen who did not take the matter seriously and reached late at the scene

title: Tarik Waseem and others
the_lynching: Two Cops were injured after a group of people allegedly resorted to stone-pelting when a police team raided their house on information of cow slaughter

title: Sheikh Bismillah Sheikh Mobin and others
the_lynching: Police arrested nine persons, including two alleged beef traders. Asked if the traders were really dealing in beef, Patil said, “We have collected the samples and have sent them to government forensic laboratory in Nagpur for tests.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Three persons, including a minor, were allegedly thrashed by a group of men when they were going to dispose of animal entrails and hide after Bakra Eid in Kanjhawla area.

title: Kaushik Purkait (24)
the_lynching: A second-year ITI student died early Tuesday after he was allegedly beaten by a mob, who suspected him to be a cattle smuggler

title: Shadab
the_lynching: MOB of villagers entered into a confrontation with the police after 11 cows were killed and as many injured when a mini-truck, which was carrying the bovines, overturned and fell into a nullah while trying to take a detour to avoid a nearby police check point.

title: Bandhna Oraon and others
the_lynching: residents of Asani Tetartoli village were worried over four deaths in a month. On Sunday, a meeting was held during which the villagers discussed the possibility of a local’s involvement in witchcraft.  “The villagers went to Bijupara in Ranchi district the next day and consulted an oracle, who gave them descriptions that matched with the victims. The oracle claimed that the two were involved in witchcraft which led to the deaths,... On Monday evening, another meeting was held during which it was decided that the Oraons needed to be killed. Villagers attacked a team of policemen and damaged their vehicles when they intervened to save two person

title: Tribal woman and others
the_lynching: A tribal women and her family were thrashed. ocals on Monday claimed to have seen the woman doing “black magic”, soon after which they started pelting stones at her house and eventually ransacked it. ocals on Monday claimed to have seen the woman doing “black magic”, soon after which they started pelting stones at her house and eventually ransacked it. The family had been suffering for more than a month. Villagers had ostracised her, claiming she was indulging in witchcraft, and they were not even allowed to draw water from the common pond.

title: Sikh men
the_lynching: The Sikh men were asking for some dhaan (paddy) from locals. They approached a woman and she started feeling drowsy. Thereafter, the local residents accused them of witchcraft and assaulted them.

title: Bali Munda (50) and others
the_lynching: Demka told us that the family was preparing to sleep after dinner, when two persons, later identified as Baga Munda and Lita Munda, both in their 30s, barged into their homes. They targeted the old couple with blunt objects. When Demka intervened, he and his wife too were attacked

title: Lohra Singh (70) and others
the_lynching: beating an elderly couple to death and then burning their bodi... they believed the couple — identified as Lohra Singh (70) and wife Chorati Devi (62) — had used witchcraft and was responsible for the death of four close relatives of the accused

title: Susari Buru (60)
the_lynching: A mother who recently lost her twins accused her 60-year-old neighbour (woman) of witchcraft and then burnt her to death.

title: Savna Oraon (55)
the_lynching: A villager went to a well near the victim's house to bathe. The villager fell in the well and died. The villagers had already suspected the victim of being a witch and after this incident they decided to teach him a lesson so they beat him to death.

title: Basanti Devi (40) and others
the_lynching: Two men from the village had gone to Bangalore to find work and for some reason died. The villagers began suspecting the two women of practicing witchcraft. After a village meeting, the villagers lynched the two women to death and their bodies were thrown into a swollen Sone River

title: Ramesh Vinayak and others
the_lynching: The police reportedly caught a youth carrying mutton packed in a gunny bags, and was on his way to deliver it. The villagers got angry over the police action and pelted stones on police jeep. They also rescued the youth from police captivity. The police, in retaliation, fired three rounds on the mob, hitting two.

title: Unknown
the_lynching: Police in Banaskantha district’s Amirgadh on Saturday arrested six people for allegedly assaulting a Dalit family, including a pregnant woman, over their refusal to remove the carcass of a cow. The accused… entered the home (of the victims) and while asking why they were not disposing of the dead cow, uttered casteist remarks, beat them with wooden sticks and assaulted them physically while threatening to kill them”.

title: Junaid Khan (15)
the_lynching: Bled to death after being repeatedly stabbed aboard a local passenger train
